list.title: DDE (Dynamic Data Exchange)
list.description: dde

list.title: DDE (Dynamic Data Exchange)~ddeExecute
list.description: Passes the specified command string to the DDE application, which is identified by the conversation ID. @DDEExecute is always used in conjunction with @DDEInitiate and @DDETerminate.

list.title: DDE (Dynamic Data Exchange)~ddeInitiate
list.description: Initiates a conversation with a DDE server, and returns the conversation ID.

list.title: DDE (Dynamic Data Exchange)~ddePoke
list.description: Deposits unsolicited data into the specified location within the DDE server application. If the data was successfully inserted into the target location, @DDEPoke returns an ACK (acknowledgement) with the value @True(1); if the attempt was not successful, the call returns a NACK (negative acknowledgment) with the value @False(0). If the conversation ID is invalid, an error is returned (see @IsError).

list.title: DDE (Dynamic Data Exchange)~ddeTerminate
list.description: Terminates the conversation with a DDE application.

list.title: ECL (Execution Control List)
list.description: ecl

list.title: ECL (Execution Control List)~editECL
list.description: Displays the administration "Workstation Security: Execution Control List" dialog box for a specified address book and name, which lets you change that administration ECL. Administrators can name Administration ECLs. The name is not usually a user name, but whatever name the administrator chooses; for example, Manager, Developer, or LimitedAccess.

list.title: ECL (Execution Control List)~editUserECL
list.description: Displays the "Workstation Security: Execution Control List" dialog box, which allows you to change your personal ECL for the current workstation.

list.title: ECL (Execution Control List)~refreshECL
list.description: Copies the administration execution control list from a specified Address Book and name to your personal workstation ECL.

list.title: module:admin
list.description: Administrative

list.title: module:admin~adminCertify
list.description: Displays the Choose Certifier ID dialog box, where you can select a Certifier ID file. After selecting a Certifier ID and entering its password, you select the user or server ID to be certified.

list.title: module:admin~adminCreateGroup
list.description: Opens a Domino® Directory and displays a blank Group form.

list.title: module:admin~adminCrossCertifyIDFile
list.description: Displays the Choose Certifier ID dialog box, where you can select a Certifier ID file. After you select a Certifier ID and enter its password, Notes® displays the Choose ID to be Cross-Certified dialog box, which allows you to create a hierarchical cross certificate for an ID in another organization.

list.title: module:admin~adminCrossCertifyKey
list.description: Displays the Choose Certifier ID dialog box, where you can select a Certifier ID file. After you select a Certifier ID and enter its password, Notes® displays the Cross Certify Key dialog box, which allows you to create a cross certificate for an ID in another organization using the numeric key associated with that ID.

list.title: module:admin~adminDatabaseAnalysis
list.description: Displays the Database Analysis dialog box, which provides information about the selected database on the selected server.

list.title: module:admin~adminDatabaseQuotas
list.description: For the selected server, displays a list of the databases in which you can change the size limits.

list.title: module:admin~adminECLIsLocked
list.description: Checks the current status of the Administration ECL in the name and address book and returns 1 (True) if the Administration ECL is locked and editing is prevented; otherwise returns 0 (False).

list.title: module:admin~adminIDFileClearPassword
list.description: Allows the administrator to delete the password associated with any user ID file, without having to first switch to that ID and make it active.

list.title: module:admin~adminIDFileExamine
list.description: Displays the Choose ID File to Examine dialog box. After the administrator selects an ID, Notes/Domino displays the ID Properties box, which contains information about security basics and your identity.

list.title: module:admin~adminIDFileSetPassword
list.description: Allows the administrator to assign a password to any user ID file, without having to first switch to that ID and make it active.

list.title: module:admin~administration
list.description: Opens the Domino® Administrator if the Domino® Administrator package is installed on the local machine of the user executing the command.

list.title: module:admin~adminNewOrganization
list.description: Displays the Register Organization Certifier dialog box, where an administrator can create a hierarchical Certifier ID for an organization. After the administrator enters a name and password for the new Certifier ID, Notes® asks the user where to save the ID file and then creates the ID.

list.title: module:admin~adminNewOrgUnit
list.description: Prompts for the Certifier ID password and then displays the Register Organizational Unit Certifier dialog box, where the administrator can create a hierarchical Certifier ID for an organizational unit.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenAddressBook
list.description: Opens a Domino® Directory on the selected server.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenCatalog
list.description: Opens the database catalog (CATALOG.NSF) on the selected server.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenCertLog
list.description: Opens the certification log (CERTLOG.NSF) on the selected server.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenGroupsView
list.description: Opens a Domino® Directory on the selected server and displays its Groups view.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenServerLog
list.description: Opens the server log (LOG.NSF) on the selected server.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenServersView
list.description: Opens a Domino® Directory on the selected server and displays its Servers view.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenStatistics
list.description: Opens the statistics reporting database (STATREP5.NSF) on the selected server.

list.title: module:admin~adminOpenUsersView
list.description: Opens a Domino® Directory on the selected server and displays its People view.

list.title: module:admin~adminOutgoingMail
list.description: Displays the contents of the selected server's MAIL.BOX file.

list.title: module:admin~adminRegisterFromFile
list.description: Displays a series of dialog boxes for certifying multiple new users from a text file.

list.title: module:admin~adminRegisterServer
list.description: Displays a series of dialog boxes for creating a new server ID.

list.title: module:admin~adminRegisterUser
list.description: Displays a series of dialog boxes for certifying new users.

list.title: module:admin~adminRemoteConsole
list.description: Displays the Remote Server Console dialog box, where an administrator can enter server console commands from a workstation.

list.title: module:admin~adminSendMailTrace
list.description: Displays the Mail Path Tracing dialog box, which allows you to send a message to a location on the mail router and receive a trace message in return.

list.title: module:admin~adminStatisticsConfig
list.description: Opens the server events database (EVENTS4.NSF) on the selected server and displays its Servers to Monitor view.

list.title: module:admin~adminTraceConnection
list.description: Displays the Trace Connections dialog box, which allows you to test network connections through a passthru server.

list.title: module:agent
list.description: Agents (Domino)

list.title: module:agent~agentEdit
list.description: Opens the Agent Properties box for the currently selected agent.

list.title: module:agent~agentEnableDisable
list.description: Enables or disables the specified agent.

list.title: module:agent~agentLog
list.description: Displays the log for the currently selected agent. The log contains information about when the agent last ran, what actions it performed, and when it finished running.

list.title: module:agent~agentRun
list.description: Runs the currently selected agent and then displays its log.

list.title: module:agent~agentSetServerName
list.description: Specifies a scheduled agent to run on a particular server.

list.title: module:agent~agentTestRun
list.description: Displays a log for the currently selected agent, describing what actions the agent will perform when run.

list.title: module:agent~isAgentEnabled
list.description: Indicates whether or not a scheduled agent is enabled.

list.title: module:agent~runAgent
list.description: Executes a specified agent.

list.title: module:agent~runScheduledAgents
list.description: Runs all of the database's scheduled agents, regardless of when they are scheduled to run. The agents will then run as usual at their regularly scheduled times.

list.title: module:attachment
list.description: Attachments

list.title: module:attachment~attachmentDetachAll
list.description: Displays the Save Attachments To dialog box, where you select a location for the current document's attachments.

list.title: module:attachment~attachmentLaunch
list.description: Launches the selected attachment by opening the application in which it was created, if possible.

list.title: module:attachment~attachmentProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current attachment.

list.title: module:attachment~attachmentView
list.description: Launches the Attachment Viewer, which lets you view the contents of the selected attachment without opening the application in which it was created.

list.title: module:compatibility
list.description: Compatibility

list.title: module:create
list.description: Create

list.title: module:create~compose
list.description: Creates a new, blank document.

list.title: module:create~composeWithReference
list.description: Creates a new document filling in the Body rich text field with values based on the current document.

list.title: module:create~createAction
list.description: Creates a new action and opens the design pane, where you can edit the action.

list.title: module:create~createAgent
list.description: Creates a new agent in the current database and opens the Agent Properties box, where you can name and define the agent.

list.title: module:create~createControlledAccessSection
list.description: Creates a controlled access section on a form or subform. Unlike a regular section, a controlled access section has a formula to determine who can edit it.

list.title: module:create~createEllipse
list.description: Lets you create an ellipse in a navigator. After you invoke the command, the cursor changes to a crosshair when you start to drag the mouse in the design area. You create an ellipse by dragging the mouse until the ellipse is the size you want.

list.title: module:create~createFolder
list.description: Displays the Create Folder dialog box, which lets you choose a location for a new folder and create it.

list.title: module:create~createForm
list.description: Creates a new, blank form in a database.

list.title: module:create~createLayoutRegion
list.description: Creates a new layout region on a form or subform.

list.title: module:create~createNavigator
list.description: Creates a new, blank navigator in a database.

list.title: module:create~createPolygon
list.description: Lets you create a polygon in a navigator. After you invoke the command, the cursor changes to a crosshair when you start to drag the mouse in the design area. You create a polygon by clicking the mouse each time you want to start a new side. Double-click when you are done.

list.title: module:create~createPolyline
list.description: Lets you create a polyline in a navigator. After you invoke the command, the cursor changes to a crosshair when you start to drag the mouse in the design area. You create a polyline by clicking the mouse each time you want to start a new line. Double-click when you are done.

list.title: module:create~createRectangle
list.description: Lets you create a rectangle in a navigator. After you invoke the command, the cursor changes to a crosshair when you start to drag the mouse in the design area. You create a rectangle by dragging the mouse until the rectangle is the size you want.

list.title: module:create~createRectangularHotspot
list.description: Lets you create a rectangular hotspot in a navigator. After you invoke the command, the cursor changes to a crosshair when you start to drag the mouse in the design area. You create a rectangular hotspot by dragging the mouse until the rectangle is the size you want.

list.title: module:create~createSection
list.description: Creates a section.

list.title: module:create~createSubform
list.description: Creates a new, blank subform in a database.

list.title: module:create~createTextbox
list.description: Lets you create a textbox in a navigator. After you invoke the command, the cursor changes to a crosshair when you start to drag the mouse in the design area. You create a textbox by dragging the mouse until the textbox is the size you want.

list.title: module:create~createView
list.description: Displays the Create View dialog box, which lets you choose a location for a new view and create it.

list.title: module:database
list.description: Database

list.title: module:database~addDatabase
list.description: Adds the specified database icon to the user's workspace, without opening the database.

list.title: module:database~addDatabaseRepID
list.description: Adds an icon to the desktop for the database specified by its replica ID.

list.title: module:database~databaseDelete
list.description: Permanently deletes the current database file from the hard disk where it is stored.

list.title: module:database~databaseReplSettings
list.description: Displays the Replication Settings dialog box for the current database.

list.title: module:database~dAverage
list.description: Finds the average of values in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dB2Schema
list.description: Given the name of a database as a text string, returns a text string containing the DB2® schema of that database if it is a db2nsf database or the empty string if it is not a db2nsf database.

list.title: module:database~dbColumn
list.description: Returns a column of values from a view or folder in a Domino® database.

list.title: module:database~dbCommand
list.description: Accesses view and folder information from a Domino® database in Web applications.

list.title: module:database~dbExists
list.description: Given a server and file name, or replica ID, indicates whether the specified database exists.

list.title: module:database~dbLookup
list.description: Given a key value, looks in the specified view (or folder) and finds all documents containing the key value within the view.

list.title: module:database~dbManager
list.description:
Returns a list of users, groups, and servers who currently have Manager access to the database. In a window title formula, only the name of the first manager listed in the ACL is displayed.

@DbManager does not work in selection formulas or column formulas.

list.title: module:database~dbName
list.description: Returns the name of the current Domino® server and database.

list.title: module:database~dbTitle
list.description: Returns the title of the current database.

list.title: module:database~dCount
list.description: Counts the number of records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria and contain numerical values.

list.title: module:database~dCountA
list.description: Counts the number of records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria and contain values (as COUNTA).

list.title: module:database~dGet
list.description: Get the single value in the field from the single record (row) in a database that matches a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dMax
list.description: Finds the maximum value in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dMin
list.description: Finds the minimum value in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~docChildren
list.description: In a column or window title formula, returns the number of child documents or categories belonging to the current document or category. Only immediate responses count as children. For example, the responses to a main document are its children, but the responses to a response document are not.

list.title: module:database~docDescendants
list.description: In a column or window title formula, returns the number of descendant documents or subcategories belonging to the current document or category. Where @DocChildren only counts direct descendants, @DocDescendants counts all descendants, regardless of level.

list.title: module:database~docLevel
list.description: Returns a text string that represents the level of the document or category.

list.title: module:database~docNumber
list.description: In a column or window title formula, returns a string representing the entry number of the current document or category. For example, 2.3 indicates that the document is the third entry following the second entry.

list.title: module:database~docParentNumber
list.description: In a column or window title formula, returns a string that represents the entry number of the parent view entry. Both the current view entry and the parent can be either documents or categories.

list.title: module:database~docSiblings
list.description: In a column or window title formula, returns a string that represents the total number of entries at the same level as a view entry (document or category). The returned total includes the document itself. For example, if the document is entry 8.2, and entries 8.1, 8.3, and 8.4 also exist, then there are four document siblings

list.title: module:database~dProduct
list.description: Finds the product of values in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dstDev
list.description: Finds the sample standard deviation in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dstDevP
list.description: Finds the population standard deviation in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dSum
list.description: Finds the sum of values in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dVar
list.description: Finds the sample variance in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~dVarP
list.description: Finds the population variance in a given field from the records (rows) in a database that match a search criteria.

list.title: module:database~findField
list.description: Not listed as a public database function in OpenFormula help

list.title: module:database~getDocField
list.description: Given the unique ID of a document, returns the contents of a specific field on that document. The document must reside in the current database.

list.title: module:database~getProfileField
list.description: Retrieves a field from a profile document, and caches the field value for the remainder of the session.

list.title: module:database~isCategory
list.description: In a column formula, returns a specified string if any item in the row of a view is defined as a category.

list.title: module:database~isDB2
list.description: Given a server and filename or server and replica ID, indicates if the specified database is backed by DB2® or not.

list.title: module:database~isExpandable
list.description: In column formulas, returns a specified string if a row in a view can be expanded.

list.title: module:database~publishDatabase
list.description: Displays the Publish Database dialog box, where the user selects a library in which to publish the selected database.

list.title: module:database~renameDatabase
list.description: For a particular database on the user's workspace, RenameDatabase locates a replica of that database (based on its replica ID) on the specified server, and replaces the database icon with that of the replica. The only change the user sees is that the server name has changed on the database icon.

list.title: module:database~replicaID
list.description: Returns the replica ID of the current database.

list.title: module:database~selectDocuments
list.description: Returns a Promise that can be resolved to an array of selected documents.

list.title: module:database~serverName
list.description: Returns the name of the server containing the current database. When the database is local, returns the user name.

list.title: module:database~setDocField
list.description: Given the unique ID of a document, sets the value of a specific field on that document. The document must reside in the current database.

list.title: module:database~setProfileField
list.description: Sets the value of a field in a profile document or creates a profile document.

list.title: module:database~switchView
list.description: Switches to the specified view or folder within the current database or, if a view or folder is not specified, displays the View menu so the user can select a view.

list.title: module:database~viewTitle
list.description: Returns the current view's name. If there are aliases and synonyms, they are returned in a text list.

list.title: module:database~webDbName
list.description: Returns the name of the current database encoded for URL inclusion.

list.title: module:date-time
list.description: Date & Time

list.title: module:date-time~accessed
list.description: Indicates the time and date when the document was last accessed by a Notes® client, whether for reading or editing.

list.title: module:date-time~adjust
list.description: Adjusts the specified time-date value by the number of years, months, days, hours, minutes, and/or seconds you specify. The amount of adjustment may be positive or negative.

list.title: module:date-time~businessDays
list.description: Returns the number of business days in one or more date ranges.

list.title: module:date-time~created
list.description: Returns the time-date when the document was created.

list.title: module:date-time~date
list.description: Constructs the date from year, month, and day of month or translates numbers for the various components of time and date, then returns the time-date value.

list.title: module:date-time~dateDif
list.description: Calculates the number of days, months, or years between two dates.

list.title: module:date-time~dateValue
list.description: Returns the string representation of the date and time from given text.

list.title: module:date-time~day
list.description: Extracts the day of the month from the specified date.

list.title: module:date-time~days
list.description: Returns the number of days between two dates.

list.title: module:date-time~days360
list.description: Calculates the number of days between two dates based on a 360-day year.

list.title: module:date-time~eDate
list.description: Returns the date and time that is the indicated number of months before or after the start date.

list.title: module:date-time~eoMonth
list.description: Returns the string representation of the date and time of the last day of the month before or after a specified number of months.

list.title: module:date-time~getCurrentTimeZone
list.description: Returns the current operating system's time zone settings in canonical time zone format.

list.title: module:date-time~hour
list.description: Extracts the number of the hour (0 through 23) from a specified Date.

list.title: module:date-time~interval
list.description: Calculates the number of years, months, days, hours, minutes and seconds from a specified number of seconds.

list.title: module:date-time~isoWeekNum
list.description: Returns the number of the ISO week number of the year for a given date.

list.title: module:date-time~locale
list.description: Returns information about language codes.

list.title: module:date-time~minute
list.description: Extracts the number of the minutes (0 through 23) from a specified Date.

list.title: module:date-time~modified
list.description: Returns a time-date value indicating when the document was modified initially.

list.title: module:date-time~month
list.description: Extracts the number of the month from the specified date.

list.title: module:date-time~netWorkDays
list.description: Return the number of whole workdays between two dates. Working days exclude weekends and any dates identified in holidays.

list.title: module:date-time~netWorkDays.intl
list.description: Return the number of whole workdays between two dates using parameters to indicate which and how many days are weekend days.

list.title: module:date-time~now
list.description: Returns the string representation of the current date and time.

list.title: module:date-time~second
list.description: Extracts the number of the seconds (0 through 23) from a specified Date. This function presumes that leap seconds never exist.

list.title: module:date-time~time
list.description: Constructs and returns a Date object from one of the following combination of time-date parameters: ( hour, minute, second ), ( year, month, day, hour, minute, second ), or Date object or array of Date objects, as per the notes formula Time function parameters.

list.title: module:date-time~timeMerge
list.description: Builds a time-date value from separate date, time, and time zone values.

list.title: module:date-time~timeValue
list.description: Converts a time in the form of text to a serial number.

list.title: module:date-time~today
list.description: Returns today's date.

list.title: module:date-time~tomorrow
list.description: Returns the time-date value that corresponds to tomorrow's date.

list.title: module:date-time~weekday
list.description: Extracts the day of the week from a date; if text, uses current locale to convert to a date. Returns a number that identifies the day.

list.title: module:date-time~weekNum
list.description:
Converts a date to a number representing where the week falls numerically with a year.

There are two systems used for this function:

  • System 1 The week containing January 1 is the first week of the year, and is numbered week 1.
  • System 2 The week containing the first Thursday of the year is the first week of the year, and is numbered as week 1. This system is the methodology specified in ISO 8601, which is commonly known as the European week numbering system.

list.title: module:date-time~workDay
list.description: Return the serial number of the date before or after a specified number of workdays.

list.title: module:date-time~workDay.intl
list.description: Return the string representation of the date before or after a specified number of workdays using parameters to indicate which and how many days are weekend days.

list.title: module:date-time~year
list.description: Extracts the number of the month from the specified date.

list.title: module:date-time~yearFrac
list.description: Returns the year fraction representing the number of whole days between start_date and end_date.

list.title: module:date-time~yesterday
list.description: Returns the time-date value which corresponds to yesterday's date.

list.title: module:date-time~zone
list.description:
Returns the time zone setting of the current computer or of a time-date value, and indicates if daylight-saving time is observed.

The time zone is represented as the number of hours that must be added to the time-date to convert it to Greenwich Mean Time.

list.title: module:design
list.description: Design

list.title: module:design.designDocumentInfo
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current document.

list.title: module:design.designFormAttributes
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current form, subform, or page.

list.title: module:design.designFormFieldDef
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the currently selected field.

list.title: module:design.designFormNewField
list.description: Creates a new field on a form or subform.

list.title: module:design.designForms
list.description: Displays the Design - Forms view of the current database.

list.title: module:design.designFormShareField
list.description: Turns a single-use field into a shared field.

list.title: module:design.designFormUseField
list.description: Displays the Insert Shared Field dialog box, where the user can select a shared field to place on the current form or subform.

list.title: module:design.designFormWindowTitle
list.description: Displays the design pane and sets the Event edit control to Window Title, so you can define a formula for a form's window title.

list.title: module:design.designHelpAboutDocument
list.description: Displays the About document in Edit mode for the current database.

list.title: module:design.designHelpUsingDocument
list.description: Displays the Using document in Edit mode for the current database.

list.title: module:design.designIcon
list.description: Displays the Design Icon dialog box, where you can edit the icon for the currently selected database.

list.title: module:design.designMacros
list.description: Displays the Agents and Release 3 macros in the current database.

list.title: module:design.designRefresh
list.description: Displays the Refresh Database Design dialog box, where the user can choose a server that contains the design template for the current database.

list.title: module:design.designReplace
list.description: Displays the Replace Database Design dialog box, where the user can choose a design template to replace that of the current database.

list.title: module:design.designSharedFields
list.description: Displays the Design - Shared Fields view in the current database.

list.title: module:design.designSynopsis
list.description: Displays the Design Synopsis dialog box so the user can select the types of information to be included in the synopsis.

list.title: module:design.designViewAppendColumn
list.description: Creates a column in a view or folder, positioned after the last column.

list.title: module:design.designViewAttributes
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current view or folder.

list.title: module:design.designViewColumnDef
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the currently selected column.

list.title: module:design.designViewEditActions
list.description: Displays or hides the action pane.

list.title: module:design.designViewFormFormula
list.description: Displays the Design Form Formula dialog box, where the user can define a formula that determines which form is used to display documents opened from a particular view or folder.

list.title: module:design.designViewNewColumn
list.description: Creates a new column before the currently selected column in a view or folder.

list.title: module:design.designViews
list.description: Displays the Design - Views view in the current database.

list.title: module:design.designViewSelectFormula
list.description: Displays the design pane and sets the Define control to View Selection, which allows you to define a selection formula to determine which documents are displayed in a view.

list.title: module:directory
list.description: Directory

list.title: module:directory~nameLookup
list.description: Searches for each specified user name across all Domino® Directories and returns a list of single text values for each specified user name.

list.title: module:directory~orgDir
list.description: In a Service Provider (xSP) environment, returns the name of the subdirectory for the company with which the currently authenticated user is registered. Notes/ Domino retrieves this information from the organization's certifier document.

list.title: module:document
list.description: Document

list.title: module:document~addToFolder
list.description: Adds current document to one folder while removing it from another. NULL string can be substituted for either argument to skip the action.

list.title: module:document~all
list.description: Returns the value True.

list.title: module:document~allChildren
list.description: Includes all response documents at all levels for parent documents that match selection criteria.

list.title: module:document~allDescendants
list.description: Includes all response and response-to-response documents for parents that match selection criteria.

list.title: module:document~attachmentLengths
list.description: Returns a number or a number list containing the length of each attachment to the current document. The number(s) returned are only approximations; the actual size(s) of the attachment(s) may be slightly different.

list.title: module:document~attachmentModifiedTimes
list.description: Returns a datetime that displays the date on which the file attachment associated with the current document was last modified. If the document contains more than one file attachment, returns the modification dates in a datetime list.

list.title: module:document~attachmentNames
list.description: Returns the operating system file names of any files attached to a document. If there are multiple files attached, the names are returned as a multiple-value text list.

list.title: module:document~attachments
list.description: Returns the number of files attached to a document.

list.title: module:document~author
list.description: Returns a text list containing the names of the author(s) of the current document.

list.title: module:document~chooseFolders
list.description: Displays the Folders dialog box, which allows you to select a folder in which to file the current document.

list.title: module:document~deleteDocument
list.description: Deletes the current document.

list.title: module:document~deleteField
list.description: Deletes the value of an editable field.

list.title: module:document~discoverFolders
list.description: Displays the "Folders containing current document" dialog box.

list.title: module:document~docFields
list.description: Returns a list of all the fields in a document.

list.title: module:document~docLength
list.description: Returns the approximate size of a document in bytes.

list.title: module:document~docLock
list.description: Locks, unlocks, returns the locked status of the current document, or indicates if a database has document locking enabled.

list.title: module:document~docMark
list.description: In an agent that runs a formula, indicates whether or not you want to save the changes to a document.

list.title: module:document~docOmmittedLength
list.description: Returns the approximate number of bytes a truncated document lost during replication. The bytes are the total number of bytes per attachment, OLE object, large rich text field, or non-summary items that were too large, according to the replication settings for the database, to be replicated.

list.title: module:document~documentUniqueID
list.description:
The universal ID, which uniquely identifies a document across all replicas of a database. In text format, the universal ID is a 32-character combination of hexadecimal digits (0-9, A-F).

The universal ID is also known as the unique ID or UNID.

list.title: module:document~formLanguage
list.description: Returns the language of the current form.

list.title: module:document~formTestDocument
list.description: Creates a document using the current form or Page, so you can test its fields, formulas, and scripts.

list.title: module:document~getField
list.description: Returns the value of a specified field.

list.title: module:document~getFieldType
list.description: Returns the type of a specified field.

list.title: module:document~getFocusTable
list.description: Returns the name, current row, or current column of the table that is in focus.

list.title: module:document~hardDeleteDocument
list.description: In an agent that runs a formula, @HardDeleteDocument permanently removes the document currently being processed from the database if the database has soft deletions enabled. If the database does not have soft deletions enabled, @HardDeleteDocument performs the same action as @DeleteDocument.

list.title: module:document~inheritedDocumentUniqueID
list.description: The unique ID of the current document's inheritance parent. See @documentUniqueID for a description of unique IDs.

list.title: module:document~isAvailable
list.description: Checks a document for the existence of a field.

list.title: module:document~isDocBeingEdited
list.description: Checks the current status of the document and returns 1 (True) if the document is being edited; otherwise returns 0 (False).

list.title: module:document~isDocBeingLoaded
list.description: Checks the current status of the document and returns 1 (True) if the document is being loaded into memory for display; otherwise returns 0 (False).

list.title: module:document~isDocBeingMailed
list.description: Checks the current status of the document and returns 1 (True) if the document is being mailed; otherwise, returns 0 (False).

list.title: module:document~isDocBeingRecalculated
list.description: Checks the current status of the document and returns 1 (True) if the document is being recalculated; otherwise, returns 0 (False).

list.title: module:document~isDocBeingSaved
list.description: Checks the current status of the document and returns 1 (True) if the document is being saved; otherwise, returns 0 (False).

list.title: module:document~isDocTruncated
list.description: Indicates whether the current document has been truncated.

list.title: module:document~isNewDoc
list.description: For a document being edited, indicates if the document has been saved to disk.

list.title: module:document~isResponseDoc
list.description: Indicates whether a document is a response to another document.

list.title: module:document~isUnavailable
list.description: Indicates whether a field name exists in a document.

list.title: module:document~moveToTrash
list.description: Marks the currently selected document for deletion.

list.title: module:document~noteID
list.description: The ID number of the current document.

list.title: module:document~openInNewWindow
list.description: Opens the specified document within a new window.

list.title: module:document~pickList
list.description:
Displays a modal window that contains either:

  • A view you specify from which the user can select one or more documents. @pickList returns a column value from the selected document(s).
  • A dialog box, displaying information from all available Domino® Directories. The user can select one or more person, group, server, room, or resource names, and @pickList returns those names.

list.title: module:document~policyIsFieldLocked
list.description: Indicates whether a field is locked by an administration policy and cannot be modified.

list.title: module:document~prompt
list.description: Get html to generate a prompt.

list.title: module:document~removeFromFolder
list.description: Removes the selected document from the current folder.

list.title: module:document~responses
list.description: Returns the number of responses (in the current view) to the document.

list.title: module:document~setField
list.description: Assigns a value to a field stored within a document (use @set for temporary variables). This is similar to using the FIELD keyword, except that @setField can be used within another @function. If the field does not exist, this command creates it and applies the specified value to it.

list.title: module:document~setTargetFrame
list.description: Allows you to specify a target frame when opening a view, page, or frameset, or when composing or editing a document.

list.title: module:document~showParentPreview
list.description: Displays the parent document preview pane.

list.title: module:document~showProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the currently selected Notes® object. For example, if a document is selected in a view, displays the document Properties box; if a field is selected on a form, displays the field Properties box.

list.title: module:document~switchForm
list.description: Changes the form used to display the current document.

list.title: module:document~unavailable
list.description: Deletes the value of an editable field.

list.title: module:document~undeleteDocument
list.description: In a database with "Allow soft deletions" selected, this command restores a deleted document.

list.title: module:document~v3EditNextField
list.description: In a document in Edit mode, moves the insertion point to the next editable field.

list.title: module:document~v3EditPrevField
list.description: In a document in Edit mode, moves the insertion point to the first editable field.

list.title: module:document~whichFolders
list.description: Returns the names of the folders containing the current document.

list.title: module:edit
list.description: Edit

list.title: module:edit~editBottom
list.description: Moves the insertion point to the end of a document or form.

list.title: module:edit~editButton
list.description: Displays the design pane and the Properties box for the selected button.

list.title: module:edit~editClear
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Delete.

list.title: module:edit~editCopy
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Copy.

list.title: module:edit~editCut
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Cut.

list.title: module:edit~editDeselectAll
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Deselect All.

list.title: module:edit~editDetach
list.description: Detaches a file attachment to a location you specify.

list.title: module:edit~editDocument
list.description: Places the current document into the mode you specify. If you don't specify a mode, toggles between Read and Edit mode.

list.title: module:edit~editDown
list.description: Moves the insertion point in a document down by the number of lines you specify. If you don't specify a number, moves the insertion point down one line.

list.title: module:edit~editEncryptionKeys
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current document, where you can edit its encryption keys.

list.title: module:edit~editFind
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Find/Replace.

list.title: module:edit~editFindInPreview
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Find/Replace without moving the focus to the editing window. This allows searches to take place when the focus is on the view or folder panes.

list.title: module:edit~editFindNext
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Find Next.

list.title: module:edit~editGotoField
list.description: In a document in Edit mode, places the insertion point in a field you specify.

list.title: module:edit~editHeaderFooter
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current document or form, which allows you to set headers, footers, and other print attributes.

list.title: module:edit~editHorizScrollbar
list.description: Toggles the horizontal scroll bar in a document.

list.title: module:edit~editIndent
list.description: Indents a paragraph 1/4 inch. The entire paragraph is indented, as well as any paragraphs that are subsequently typed below it, until the user disables indenting.

list.title: module:edit~editIndentFirstLine
list.description: Indents the first line of a paragraph 1/4 inch. The first line of the current paragraph is indented, as well as first lines of subsequently typed paragraphs, until the user disables indenting. (A carriage return defines a new paragraph.)

list.title: module:edit~editInsertButton
list.description: Creates a new button and displays the design pane, where the user can define a formula, simple action(s), LotusScript®, or JavaScript™ for the button.

list.title: module:edit~editInsertFileAttachment
list.description: Attaches a file to a document.

list.title: module:edit~editInsertObject
list.description: Inserts an object into a document, form, or subform.

list.title: module:edit~editInsertPageBreak
list.description: Inserts a forced page break into a document, form, subform, or page.

list.title: module:edit~editInsertPopup
list.description: Creates a hotspot that displays text.

list.title: module:edit~editInsertTable
list.description: Displays the Create Table dialog box, where the user can specify the number of rows and columns in a new table.

list.title: module:edit~editInsertText
list.description: Inserts the specified string at the current cursor position.

list.title: module:edit~editLeft
list.description: Moves the insertion point in a document, form, subform, or page to the left by the number of spaces you specify. If you don't specify a number, moves the insertion point one space to the left.

list.title: module:edit~editLinks
list.description: Displays the External Links dialog box.

list.title: module:edit~editLocations
list.description: Opens the Personal Address Book to the Locations view.

list.title: module:edit~editMakeDocLink
list.description: Creates a link to the current document and copies it to the Clipboard. The user can paste the link into any rich text field.

list.title: module:edit~editNextField
list.description: In a document in Edit mode, moves the insertion point to the next editable field in the document, working left to right, beginning to end.

list.title: module:edit~editOpenLink
list.description: Opens the selected link.

list.title: module:edit~editOwnerVCard
list.description: Displays the My Contact/vCard Edit dialog using the Contact form.

list.title: module:edit~editPaste
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Paste.

list.title: module:edit~editPasteSpecial
list.description: Displays the Paste Special dialog box.

list.title: module:edit~editPhoneNumbers
list.description: Displays the Server/Connections view of the Personal Address Book.

list.title: module:edit~editPrevField
list.description: In a document in Edit mode, moves the insertion point to the previous editable field in the document, working right to left, end to beginning.

list.title: module:edit~editProfile
list.description: Opens a new or existing profile document in Edit mode.

list.title: module:edit~editProfileDocument
list.description: Creates a new or opens an existing profile document in Edit mode.

list.title: module:edit~editQuoteSelection
list.description: Makes selected text look like an Internet-style reply by prefixing each line with a greater-than sign and removing attachments and other objects. This sets each line of the message to a default length, preventing it from wrapping in unexpected places when sent to non-Notes users.

list.title: module:edit~editResizePicture
list.description: Displays the proportions of the selected graphic at the end of the screen. The user can size the picture by dragging the mouse in the appropriate direction.

list.title: module:edit~editRestoreDocument
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Restore.

list.title: module:edit~editRight
list.description: Moves the insertion point in a document to the right by the number of spaces you specify. If you don't specify a number, moves the insertion point one space to the right.

list.title: module:edit~editSelectAll
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Select All.

list.title: module:edit~editSelectByDate
list.description: Displays the Select by Date dialog box, where the user indicates which documents should be selected in the view or folder, according to the date they were created or last modified.

list.title: module:edit~editShowHideHiddenChars
list.description: Toggles the display of the hidden characters (such as spaces, tabs, and carriage returns) in a document, form, or subform.

list.title: module:edit~editTableDeleteRowColumn
list.description: Displays the Delete Row/Column dialog box, where the user can select the number of rows or columns to delete from the current table.

list.title: module:edit~editTableFormat
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the selected table.

list.title: module:edit~editTableInsertRowColumn
list.description: Displays the Insert Row/Column dialog box, where the user can select the number of rows or columns to insert into the table.

list.title: module:edit~editTop
list.description: Moves the insertion point to the beginning of a document or form.

list.title: module:edit~editUndo
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Undo, which undoes the previous reversible operation.

list.title: module:edit~editUntruncate
list.description: Retrieves the full version of a truncated document.

list.title: module:edit~editUp
list.description: Moves the insertion point in a document up by the number of lines you specify. If you don't specify a number, moves the insertion point up one line.

list.title: module:engineering
list.description: Engineering

list.title: module:engineering~besselI
list.description: Returns the modified Bessel function In(x).

list.title: module:engineering~besselJ
list.description: Returns the Bessel function Jn(x).

list.title: module:engineering~besselK
list.description: Returns the modified Bessel function Kn(x).

list.title: module:engineering~besselY
list.description: Returns the Bessel function Yn(x).

list.title: module:engineering~bin2Dec
list.description: Converts a binary number to decimal.

list.title: module:engineering~bin2Hex
list.description: Converts a binary number to hexadecimal.

list.title: module:engineering~bin2Oct
list.description: Converts a binary number to octal.

list.title: module:engineering~bitAnd
list.description: Returns a bitwise 'AND' of two numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~bitLShift
list.description: Returns a value number shifted left by shift_amount bits.

list.title: module:engineering~bitOr
list.description: Returns a bitwise 'OR' of two numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~bitRShift
list.description: Returns a value number shifted right by shift_amount bits.

list.title: module:engineering~bitXOr
list.description: Returns a bitwise 'XOR' of two numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~complex
list.description: Converts real and imaginary coefficients into a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~convert
list.description: Converts a number from one measurement system to another.

list.title: module:engineering~dec2Bin
list.description: Converts a decimal number to binary.

list.title: module:engineering~dec2Hex
list.description: Converts a decimal number to hexadecimal.

list.title: module:engineering~dec2Oct
list.description: Converts a decimal number to octal.

list.title: module:engineering~delta
list.description: Tests whether two values are equal.

list.title: module:engineering~erf
list.description: Returns the error function integrated between lower_limit and upper_limit.

list.title: module:engineering~erf.precise
list.description: Returns the error function.

list.title: module:engineering~erfc
list.description: Returns the complementary error function.

list.title: module:engineering~erfc.precise
list.description: Returns the complementary ERF function integrated between x and infinity.

list.title: module:engineering~geStep
list.description: Tests whether a number is greater than a threshold value.

list.title: module:engineering~hex2Bin
list.description: Converts a hexadecimal number to binary.

list.title: module:engineering~hex2Dec
list.description: Converts a hexadecimal number to decimal.

list.title: module:engineering~hex2Oct
list.description: Converts a hexadecimal number to octal

list.title: module:engineering~imAbs
list.description: Returns the absolute value (modulus) of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imaginary
list.description: Returns the imaginary coefficient of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imArgument
list.description: Returns the argument theta, an angle expressed in radians.

list.title: module:engineering~imConjugate
list.description: Returns the complex conjugate of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imCos
list.description: Returns the cosine of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imCosh
list.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imCot
list.description: Returns the cotangent of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imCsc
list.description: Returns the cosecant of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imCsch
list.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosecant of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imDiv
list.description: Returns the quotient of two complex numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~imExp
list.description: Returns the exponential of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imLn
list.description: Returns the natural logarithm of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imLog2
list.description: Returns the base-2 logarithm of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imLog10
list.description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imPower
list.description: Returns a complex number raised to an integer power.

list.title: module:engineering~imProduct
list.description: Returns the product of from 2 to 255 complex numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~imReal
list.description: Returns the real coefficient of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imSec
list.description: Returns the secant of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imSech
list.description: Returns the hyperbolic secant of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imSin
list.description: Returns the sine of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imSinh
list.description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imSqrt
list.description: Returns the square root of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~imSub
list.description: Returns the difference between two complex numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~imSum
list.description: Returns the sum of complex numbers.

list.title: module:engineering~imTan
list.description: Returns the tangent of a complex number.

list.title: module:engineering~oct2Bin
list.description: Converts an octal number to binary.

list.title: module:engineering~oct2Dec
list.description: Converts an octal number to decimal.

list.title: module:engineering~oct2Hex
list.description: Converts an octal number to hexadecimal.

list.title: module:file
list.description: File

list.title: module:file~fileCloseWindow
list.description: Closes the current Notes® window. If the document or design element in that window has not been saved, Notes® prompts the user to save it before closing.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseACL
list.description: Displays the access control list for the current database.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseCompact
list.description: Compacts the white space in a database, and at the same time, converts the old database to the new format.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseCopy
list.description: Displays the Copy Database dialog box, where the user can copy the current database to a new location.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseDelete
list.description: Permanently deletes the current database file from the hard disk where it is stored.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseInfo
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current database.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseRemove
list.description: Removes the current database icon from the workspace.

list.title: module:file~fileDatabaseUseServer
list.description: Displays the Switch Servers dialog box, where the user can choose a server that contains a replica of the currently selected database.

list.title: module:file~fileExit
list.description: Performs the menu command File - Exit (File - Quit on the Macintosh), which closes Notes/Domino and all its open windows.

list.title: module:file~fileExport
list.description: Exports a Notes/Domino document or view.

list.title: module:file~fileFullTextCreate
list.description: Displays the Full-Text Create Index dialog box, where the user can specify settings for the database's full-text index.

list.title: module:file~fileFullTextDelete
list.description: Deletes a database's full-text index.

list.title: module:file~fileFullTextInfo
list.description: Displays the Full Text tab of the current database's Properties box.

list.title: module:file~fileFullTextUpdate
list.description: Updates full-text indexes for local databases or queues the update request for server-based databases.

list.title: module:file~fileImport
list.description: Imports a file into a Notes/Domino document or view.

list.title: module:file~fileNewDatabase
list.description: Displays the New Database dialog box, where the user can select a server, title, and file name for a new database.

list.title: module:file~fileNewReplica
list.description: Displays the New Replica dialog box, where the user can create a replica of the current database.

list.title: module:file~fileOpenDatabase
list.description: Opens the specified database to the specified view, highlighting the first document whose value in the sort column matches the key. You specify a database using its server and file name.

list.title: module:file~fileOpenDBRepID
list.description: Opens the specified database to the specified view, highlighting the first document whose value in the sort column matches the key. You specify a database using its replica ID, and Notes/Domino searches the workspace and all servers available in the current session to find a replica.

list.title: module:file~filePageSetup
list.description: Displays the Page Setup dialog box (or, on the Macintosh, the File Print Margins dialog box), which allows you to specify print settings for the selected database.

list.title: module:file~filePrint
list.description: Prints the currently open or selected document(s), or the current view.

list.title: module:file~filePrintSetup
list.description: Displays the Print Setup dialog box, which allows you to direct the current view or document to a printer or a file that you specify.

list.title: module:file~fileSave
list.description: Performs the menu command File - Save.

list.title: module:file~fileSaveNewVersion
list.description: Saves a document as a new version.

list.title: module:financial
list.description: Financial

list.title: module:financial~accrInt
list.description: Returns the modified Bessel function In(x).

list.title: module:financial~accrIntM
list.description:
Returns the accrued interest for a security that pays interest at maturity.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~amorDegrc
list.description:
Returns the depreciation for each accounting period by using a depreciation coefficient.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~amorLinc
list.description:
Returns the depreciation for each accounting period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~coupDayBS
list.description:
Returns the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~coupDays
list.description:
Returns the number of days in the coupon period that contains the settlement date.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~coupDaySnc
list.description:
Returns the number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon date.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~coupNCD
list.description:
Returns the next coupon date after the settlement date.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~coupNum
list.description:
Returns the number of coupons payable between the settlement date and maturity date.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~coupPCD
list.description:
Returns the previous coupon date before the settlement date.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~cumIPmt
list.description:
Returns the cumulative interest paid between two periods.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~cumPrinc
list.description:
Returns the cumulative principal paid on a loan between two periods.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~db
list.description:
Returns the depreciation of an asset for a specified period by using the fixed-declining balance method.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~ddb
list.description:
Returns the depreciation of an asset for a specified period by using the double-declining balance method or some other method that you specify.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~disc
list.description:
Returns the discount rate for a security.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~dollarDe
list.description:
Converts a dollar price, expressed as a fraction, into a dollar price, expressed as a decimal number.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~dollarFr
list.description:
Converts a dollar price, expressed as a decimal number, into a dollar price, expressed as a fraction.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~duration
list.description:
Returns the annual duration of a security with periodic interest payments.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~effect
list.description:
Returns the effective annual interest rate.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~fv
list.description:
Returns the future value of an investment.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~fvSchedule
list.description:
Returns the future value of an initial principal after applying a series of compound interest rates.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~intRate
list.description:
Returns the interest rate for a fully invested security.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~iPmt
list.description:
Returns the interest payment for an investment for a given period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~irr
list.description:
Returns the internal rate of return for a series of cash flows.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~isPmt
list.description:
Calculates the interest paid during a specific period of an investment.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~mDuration
list.description:
Returns the Macauley modified duration for a security with an assumed par value of $100.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~mirr
list.description:
Returns the internal rate of return where positive and negative cash flows are financed at different rates.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~nominal
list.description:
Returns the annual nominal interest rate.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~nPer
list.description:
Returns the number of periods for an investment.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~npv
list.description:
Returns the net present value of an investment based on a series of periodic cash flows and a discount rate.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~oddFPrice
list.description:
Returns the price per $100 face value of a security with an odd first period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~oddFYield
list.description:
Returns the yield of a security with an odd first period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~oddLPrice
list.description:
Returns the price per $100 face value of a security with an odd last period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~oddLYield
list.description:
Returns the yield of a security with an odd last period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~pDuration
list.description:
Returns the number of periods required by an investment to reach a specified value.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~pmt
list.description:
Returns the periodic payment for an annuity.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~pPmt
list.description:
Returns the payment on the principal for an investment for a given period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~price
list.description:
Returns the price per $100 face value of a security that pays periodic interest.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~priceDisc
list.description:
Returns the price per $100 face value of a discounted security.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~priceMat
list.description:
Returns the price per $100 face value of a security that pays interest at maturity.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~pv
list.description:
Returns the present value of an investment.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~rate
list.description:
Returns the interest rate per period of an annuity.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~received
list.description:
Returns the amount received at maturity for a fully invested security.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~rri
list.description:
Returns an equivalent interest rate for the growth of an investment.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~sln
list.description:
Returns the straight-line depreciation of an asset for one period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~syd
list.description:
Returns the sum-of-years' digits depreciation of an asset for a specified period.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~tbillEq
list.description:
Returns the bond-equivalent yield for a Treasury bill.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~tbillPrice
list.description:
Returns the price per $100 face value for a Treasury bill.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~tbillYield
list.description:
Returns the yield for a Treasury bill.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~vdb
list.description:
Returns the depreciation of an asset for a specified or partial period by using a declining balance method.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~xirr
list.description:
Returns the internal rate of return for a schedule of cash flows that is not necessarily periodic.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~xnpv
list.description:
Returns the net present value for a schedule of cash flows that is not necessarily periodic.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~Yield
list.description:
Returns the yield on a security that pays periodic interest.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~yieldDisc
list.description:
Returns the annual yield for a discounted security; for example, a Treasury bill.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:financial~yieldMat
list.description:
Returns the annual yield of a security that pays interest at maturity.

Category: Financial

list.title: module:folder
list.description: Folder

list.title: module:folder~folder
list.description: Moves or copies the selected document to a folder.

list.title: module:folder~folderCollapse
list.description: For a folder or view containing nested folders or views, collapses the selected folder or view in the navigation pane.

list.title: module:folder~folderCustomize
list.description: Displays the design pane for the currently selected view or folder.

list.title: module:folder~folderDocuments
list.description: Moves or copies the selected document to a folder.

list.title: module:folder~folderExpand
list.description: Expands the currently selected view or folder one level in the navigation pane.

list.title: module:folder~folderExpandAll
list.description: Fully expands all views and folders in the navigation pane.

list.title: module:folder~folderExpandWithChildren
list.description: Fully expands the selected view or folder in the navigation pane.

list.title: module:folder~folderMove
list.description: Displays the Move dialog box for a view or folder, which allows you to move the selected view or folder.

list.title: module:folder~folderProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for a view or folder.

list.title: module:folder~folderRename
list.description: Displays the Rename dialog box, which allows you to rename the selected folder or view.

list.title: module:formula
list.description: formula

list.title: module:formula~checkFormulaSyntax
list.description: Checks a block of commented out formula language code for errors.

list.title: module:formula~command
list.description:
Executes a Notes/Domino command. Most of the standard menu commands can be executed using @Command. In addition, a number of specialized commands are available. In a formula, any command invoked using @Command runs in the order you specify in the formula. This means that any changes made by the command, such as inserting text into a field, affect the rest of the formula (see exceptions).

In the context of RosettaJS, the @Command is a Notes @Formula function that does not exist in the functions of the Notes @Formula language but rather an

list.title: module:formula~Eval
list.description: At run-time, compiles and runs each element in a text expression as a formula. Returns the result of the last formula expression in the list or an error if an error is generated by any of the formula expressions in the list.

list.title: module:formula~isValid
list.description: Executes all validation formulas within the current form.

list.title: module:formula~set
list.description: Assigns a value to a temporary variable for use within a formula.

list.title: module:formula~updateFormulaContext
list.description: Updates the context of a formula to the Notes® client window currently being accessed by the code. For example, if the code accesses a new form called "Response" by using @Command([Compose]:"Response", @UpdateFormulaContext switches the context of the formula to this new form. Any subsequent functions in the code execute in the context of the Response document, not the current document.

list.title: module:help
list.description: Help

list.title: module:help~helpAboutDatabase
list.description: Displays the About This Database or database policy document for the current database (which typically explains the purpose of the application, as well as its intended audience).

list.title: module:help~helpAboutNotes
list.description: Displays the Notes® splash screen that appears when you launch Notes/Domino. The screen displays the current release number and date.

list.title: module:help~helpUsingDatabase
list.description: Displays the Using This Database document for the current database. The Using This Database document typically provides pointers on how to use an application's forms and views.

list.title: module:information
list.description: Information

list.title: module:information~browserInfo
list.description: Determines the capabilities of a Web client, that is you can determine the properties of the browser for the current request.

list.title: module:information~cell
list.description: Returns information about the formatting, location, or contents of a value. Category: Information

list.title: module:information~clientType
list.description: Returns a text string to differentiate Notes® clients and World Wide Web browsers.

list.title: module:information~configFile
list.description: Returns the file path for the initialization file for Notes® (notes.ini).

list.title: module:information~fontList
list.description: Provides a list of available fonts on the Notes® client where this @function is executed.

list.title: module:information~getAddressBooks
list.description: Returns a list of the address books associated with a client (if the current database is local) or server.

list.title: module:information~info
list.description: Returns information about the current operating environment. Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isAppInstalled
list.description: Indicates whether the specified type of application is installed.

list.title: module:information~isBinary
list.description: Formula.js only

list.title: module:information~isBlank
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is blank.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isEmbeddedInsideWCT
list.description: Indicates whether any part of the current Notes® session is embedded inside of Workplace client.

list.title: module:information~isErr
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is any error value except #N/A.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isError
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is any error value.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isEven
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the number is even.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isFormula
list.description: Returns TRUE if there is a reference to a value that contains a formula. Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isInCompositeApp
list.description: Indicates whether the component is running within a composite application.

list.title: module:information~isLogical
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is a logical value.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isModalHelp
list.description: Indicates whether the current document is a modal Help document.

list.title: module:information~isNA
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is the #N/A error value.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isNonText
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is not text.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isNumber
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is a number.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isOdd
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the number is odd.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isRef
list.description: Returns TRUE if the value is a reference. Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isText
list.description:
Returns TRUE if the value is text.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~isUsingJavaElement
list.description: Indicates whether a view or outline uses the Java™ user interface.

list.title: module:information~isVirtualizedDirectory
list.description: Indicates whether virtualized directories are enabled for the current server.

list.title: module:information~languagePreference
list.description: Returns user's specified preferred language setting.

list.title: module:information~ldapServer
list.description:
Returns the URL and port number of the LDAP listener in the current domain. Notes® looks for this information in several places, following this search sequence:

  1. Searches on the current server.
  2. Searches for the notes.ini variable labeled LDAPSERVER=.
  3. Queries the administration server, which runs the LDAP service automatically, by default.

list.title: module:information~n
list.description:
Returns a value converted to a number.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~na
list.description:
Returns the error value #N/A.

Category: Information

list.title: module:information~notesError
list.description: Allows you to generate an error condition within an expression. This is useful if you want to evaluate the current values in several fields and need to know if an error has occurred in the entry of any of them.

list.title: module:information~regQueryValue
list.description: Copies the administration execution control list from a specified Address Book and name to your personal workstation ECL.

list.title: module:information~serverAccess
list.description: Checks if a specified user has a specified administrative access level to a server.

list.title: module:information~sheet
list.description: Returns the sheet number of the referenced sheet. Category: Information

list.title: module:information~sheets
list.description: Returns the number of sheets in a reference. Category: Information

list.title: module:information~soundex
list.description: Returns the Soundex (the Notes® phonetic speller) code for the specified string.

list.title: module:information~templateVersion
list.description: Returns the version number of the master template upon which the database design is based.

list.title: module:information~thisName
list.description: Returns the name of the current field.

list.title: module:information~thisValue
list.description: Returns the value of the current field.

list.title: module:information~type
list.description:
Returns a number indicating the data type of a value.

Category: Information

list.title: module:layout
list.description: Layout

list.title: module:layout~layoutAddGraphic
list.description: Adds a graphic from the Clipboard to a layout region.

list.title: module:layout~layoutAddText
list.description: Creates a static text box in a layout region.

list.title: module:layout~layoutElementBringToFront
list.description: Brings the selected layout element to the front, which means it overlays any other layout elements that overlap it.

list.title: module:layout~layoutElementProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the currently selected layout element.

list.title: module:layout~layoutElementSendToBack
list.description: Sends the selected layout element to the back, which means it displays underneath any other layout elements that overlap it.

list.title: module:layout~layoutProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the currently selected layout region.

list.title: module:lists
list.description: Lists

list.title: module:lists~count
list.description:
Calculates the number of text, number, or time-date values in a list. This function always returns a number to indicate the number of entries in the list.

This function is similar to @Elements, except that it returns the number 1 instead of 0, when the value it is evaluating is not a list or is a null string.

list.title: module:lists~elements
list.description: Calculates the number of text, number, or time-date values in a list. This function always returns a number to indicate the number of entries in the list.

list.title: module:lists~explode
list.description:
Returns a text list composed of the elements of a text string or date range.

  • If you specify a text string, elements are defined as sequences of characters separated by separator characters and newlines.
  • If you specify a time-date range, elements are defined as individual days within the range.

list.title: module:lists~implode
list.description: Concatenates all members of a text list and returns a text string.

list.title: module:lists~isMember
list.description: Indicates if a piece of text (or a text list) is contained within another text list. The function is case-sensitive.

list.title: module:lists~isNotMember
list.description: Indicates if a text string (or a text list) is not contained within another text list. The function is case-sensitive.

list.title: module:lists~keywords
list.description: Given two text lists, returns only those items from the second list that are found in the first list.

list.title: module:lists~member
list.description: Given a value, finds its position in a text list.

list.title: module:lists~nothing
list.description: Use with an @Transform formula. Returns no list element (reducing the return list by one element). Not valid in any other context.

list.title: module:lists~replace
list.description: Repeats a string a specified number of times.

list.title: module:lists~select
list.description: Returns the value that appears in the number position. If the number is greater than the number of values, @Select returns the last value in the list. If the value in the number position is a list, returns the entire list contained within the value.

list.title: module:lists~sort
list.description: Sorts a list.

list.title: module:lists~subset
