list.description: Searches a list from beginning to end and returns the number values you specify. If you specify a negative number, @Subset searches the list from end to beginning, but the result is ordered as from the beginning of the list.

list.title: module:lists~transform
list.description: Applies a formula to each element of a list and returns the results in a list.

list.title: module:lists~unique
list.description: Without a parameter, returns a random, unique text value. With a parameter, removes duplicate values from a text list by returning only the first occurrence of each member of the list.

list.title: module:logical
list.description: Logical

list.title: module:logical.and
list.description: Returns TRUE if all of its arguments are TRUE.

list.title: module:logical.do
list.description: Evaluates expressions from left to right, and returns the value of the last expression in the list.

list.title: module:logical.doWhile
list.description: Executes one or more statements iteratively while a condition is true. Checks the condition after executing the statements.

list.title: module:logical.failure
list.description: Returns text that indicates that input to a field does not meet validation.

list.title: module:logical.false
list.description: Returns the logical value false (or the number 0).

list.title: module:logical.for
list.description: Executes one or more statements iteratively while a condition remains true. Executes an initialization statement. Checks the condition before executing the statements and executes an increment statement after executing the statements.

list.title: module:logical.if
list.description: Specifies a logical test to perform and returns the specified value determined by the test.

list.title: module:logical.ifError
list.description: Returns a value you specify if a formula evaluates to an error; otherwise, returns the result of the formula.

list.title: module:logical.ifNA
list.description: Returns the value you specify if the expression resolves to #N/A, otherwise returns the result of the expression.

list.title: module:logical.ifs
list.description: Checks whether one or more conditions are met and returns a value that corresponds to the first TRUE condition.

list.title: module:logical.isNull
list.description: Tests for a null value. Returns true only if a value is a single text value that is null, otherwise it returns false. This function also returns false if the value is an error.

list.title: module:logical.no
list.description: Returns the number 0 (false).

list.title: module:logical.not
list.description: Reverses the logic of its argument.

list.title: module:logical.or
list.description: Returns TRUE if any argument is TRUE.

list.title: module:logical.return
list.description: Immediately stops the execution of a formula and returns the specified value. This is useful when you only want the remainder of the formula to be executed only if certain conditions are True.

list.title: module:logical.success
list.description: Returns 1 (True). Use this function with @If in field validation formulas to indicate that the value entered satisfies the validation criteria.

list.title: module:logical.switch
list.description: Evaluates an expression against a list of values and returns the result corresponding to the first matching value. If there is no match, an optional default value may be returned.

list.title: module:logical.true
list.description: Returns the logical value true (or the number 1).

list.title: module:logical.v2If
list.description: This function performs an @If operation; the syntax is the same as for @if.

list.title: module:logical.while
list.description: Returns the names of the folders containing the current document.

list.title: module:logical.xor
list.description: Returns a logical exclusive OR of all arguments.

list.title: module:logical.yes
list.description: Returns the number 1 (true).

list.title: module:lookup-reference
list.description: Lookup Reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~choose
list.description:
Chooses a value from a list of values.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~column
list.description:
Returns the column number of a reference.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~columns
list.description:
Returns the number of columns in a reference.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~hLookup
list.description:
Looks in the top row of an array and returns the value of the indicated value.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~index
list.description:
Uses an index to choose a value from a reference or array.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~lookup
list.description:
Looks up values in a vector or array.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~match
list.description:
Looks up values in a reference or array.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~row
list.description:
Returns the row number of a reference.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~rows
list.description:
Returns the number of rows in a reference.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~transpose
list.description:
Returns the transpose of an array.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:lookup-reference~unique
list.description: Returns a list of unique values in a list or range.

list.title: module:lookup-reference~vLookup
list.description:
Looks in the first column of an array and moves across the row to return the value of a value.

Category: Lookup and reference

list.title: module:mail
list.description: Mail

list.title: module:mail~mailAddress
list.description: Displays the Select Addresses dialog box, where the user can select people and groups to include in an address field of a mail document.

list.title: module:mail~mailComposeMemo
list.description: Creates and displays a blank mail document. Notes/Domino uses the default form for the user's mail database. This is a Memo document unless the user has changed it.

list.title: module:mail~mailEncryptSavedPreference
list.description: Indicates whether the user has selected "Encrypt saved mail" in the User Preferences dialog box.

list.title: module:mail~mailEncryptSentPreference
list.description: Indicates whether the user has selected "Encrypt sent mail" in the User Preferences dialog box.

list.title: module:mail~mailForward
list.description: Forwards the current document by placing its contents into a mail memo, which the user then addresses and sends like any other mail memo.

list.title: module:mail~mailForwardAsAttachment
list.description: In cc:Mail, forwards a Notes/Domino document as a cc:Mail attachment.

list.title: module:mail~mailOpen
list.description: Opens the user's mail database to the view or navigator to which it was most recently open.

list.title: module:mail~mailRequestCrossCert
list.description: Displays the Choose ID to be Cross-Certified dialog box, which allows an administrator to send a safe copy of a Certifier ID to another administrator, who can certify it with a different Certifier ID to create a cross certificate.

list.title: module:mail~mailRequestNewName
list.description: Displays the Change User Name dialog box, which allows the user to send a portion of the Notes® user ID to a Notes/Domino administrator, who can change the user name associated with the ID and return the ID to the user. The user then merges the updated portion back into the existing user ID.

list.title: module:mail~mailRequestNewPublicKey
list.description: Displays the Mail New Public Key Request dialog box, which allows the user to send a portion of his or her Notes/Domino ID to an administrator, who can create a new public key for the ID and return the ID to the user. The user then merges the updated portion back into the existing user ID.

list.title: module:mail~mailSavePreference
list.description: Indicates which option the user has selected for the "Save sent mail"setting in the User Preferences dialog box.

list.title: module:mail~mailScanUnread
list.description: Opens the user's mail database to the first unread document in the view to which the database was most recently open.

list.title: module:mail~mailSend
list.description: Displays the Mail Send dialog box, which lets the user choose whether or not to encrypt, sign, or send the selected memo.

list.title: module:mail~mailSendCertificateRequest
list.description: Displays the Mail Certificate Request dialog box. This lets the user send a safe copy of the Notes/Domino user ID to an administrator, who certifies and then returns it; the user then merges the updated safe copy back into the user ID.

list.title: module:mail~mailSendEncryptionKey
list.description: Displays the User ID dialog box, where the user can define and send encryption keys. If the user's ID is password-protected, the user will be required to enter the password before being allowed access to the dialog box.

list.title: module:mail~mailSendPublicKey
list.description: Displays the Mail Public Key dialog box. This lets the user send the public key to another user (typically to an administrator who can then paste the public key into that user's Person record in the Domino® Directory).

list.title: module:mail~mailSignPreference
list.description: Indicates whether the user has selected "Sign sent mail" in the User Preferences dialog box.

list.title: module:math-trig
list.description: Math and Trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~abs
list.description:
Returns the absolute (unsigned) value of one or more number(s).

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~acos
list.description:
Returns the arccosine (inverse cosine) of a number using the cosine of an angle.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~acosh
list.description:
Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~acot
list.description:
Returns the inverse cotangent of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~acoth
list.description:
Returns the inverse hyperbolic cotangent of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~add
list.description:
Returns the sum of the two given numbers.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~aggregate
list.description:
Returns an aggregate in a list or database.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~arabic
list.description:
Converts a Roman number to Arabic, as a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~asin
list.description:
Returns the arcsine (inverse sine) of a number using the sine of an angle.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~asinh
list.description:
Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~atan
list.description:
Returns the arc (inverse) tangent using the tangent of an angle.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~atan2
list.description:
Returns the arc (inverse) tangent using the tangent x- and y-coordinates.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~atanh
list.description:
Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~base
list.description:
Converts a number into a text representation with the given radix (base).

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~ceiling
list.description:
Rounds a number to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~combin
list.description:
Returns the number of combinations for a given number of objects.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~combina
list.description:
Returns the number of combinations with repetitions for a given number of items.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~cos
list.description:
Given an angle in radians, returns the cosine of the angle. In a right triangle, the cosine of an acute angle is the ratio of the length of its adjacent side to the length of the hypotenuse.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~cosh
list.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of the angle.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~cot
list.description:
Returns the cotangent of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~coth
list.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cotangent of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~csc
list.description:
Returns the cosecant of an angle.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~csch
list.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosecant of an angle.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~decimal
list.description:
Converts a text representation of a number in a given base into a decimal number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~degrees
list.description:
Converts radians to degrees.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~divide
list.description:
Returns the quotient of the two given numbers.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~e
list.description:
Returns the mathematical constant e (approximately 2.718282).

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~eq
list.description:
Returns whether the first number is equal to the second number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~even
list.description:
Rounds a number up to the nearest even integer.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~exp
list.description:
Returns e (approximately 2.718282) raised to the power of a given number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~fact
list.description:
Returns the factorial of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~factDouble
list.description:
Returns the double factorial of a number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~floatEq
list.description:
Compares two numbers for equality within a confidence range.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~floor
list.description:
Rounds a number down, toward zero.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~gcd
list.description:
Returns the greatest common divisor.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~gt
list.description:
Returns whether the first number is greater than the second number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~gte
list.description:
Returns whether the first number is greater than or equal to the second number.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~int
list.description:
Truncates the values in a number or number list at the whole number, leaving off any decimals.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~integer
list.description:
Truncates the values in a number or number list at the whole number, leaving off any decimals.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.title: module:math-trig~lcm
list.description:
Returns the least common multiple.

Category: Math and trigonometry

list.description: Adds a bookmark with the specified URL or current object.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~addToIMContactList
list.description: Adds a name or names to a personal group in the Instant Messaging Contact List.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~calendarFormat
list.description: Changes the Calendar view to display one day, two days, one work week, one week, two work weeks, two weeks, one work month, one month, or one year.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~calendarGoTo
list.description: Goes to a particular date in a Calendar view.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~checkAlarms
list.description: Triggers the alarm daemon to check for new alarms in the mail file.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~checkCalendar
list.description: Pops up a dialog box containing a one-day calendar view. The current database must contain a calendar view for this command to function properly.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~clear
list.description: Performs the menu command Edit - Delete.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~copySelectedAsTable
list.description: Copies one or more selected entries as a table.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~debugLotusScript
list.description: Puts Designer into debug mode, so that all LotusScript® scripts run in the debugger. The command is a toggle; selecting it again takes Notes® out of debug mode.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~dialingRules
list.description: Displays the Dialing Rules dialog box, which allows you to define dialing rules for a modem in a Location document in a Domino® Directory.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~dialogBox
list.description:
Brings up a dialog box that displays the current document (either open or selected in a view). The dialog box shares fields with the underlying document. The user interacts with the dialog box as usual, clicking OK or Cancel when finished.

This function can be used with any form, but it's particularly useful with forms that contain a single table or layout region, because the user can interact with the table or layout region as if it were a dialog box.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~directories
list.description: Displays the Directories dialog box which allows you to search for an address, view detailed information about an address entry, and add an entry to your Domino® Directory with the Directories dialog box.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~enableAlarms
list.description: Starts or stops the alarm daemon.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~environment
list.description: Sets or returns an environment variable stored in a formula.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~exchangeUnreadMarks
list.description: For two selected database replicas, marks the documents as read in one replica that are marked as read in the other.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~execute
list.description: Launches an application.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~exitNotes
list.description: Performs the menu command File - Exit (File - Quit on the Macintosh), which closes Notes/Domino and all its open windows.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~findFreeTimeDialog
list.description: Opens the Free Time dialog box to allow searches for available meeting times.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~formActions
list.description: Displays the actions pane for the current form, subform, or Page. The command is a toggle; selecting it again hides the actions pane.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~goUpLevel
list.description: Displays the view containing the current document when the user closes that document.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~hashPassword
list.description: Encodes a string.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~insertSubform
list.description: Displays the Insert Subform dialog box, where you can select a subform to be inserted on a form.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~launchApp
list.description: Launches the requested Domino® application.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~mailSend
list.description:
There are two ways to use @MailSend:

  • When used with no parameters, @MailSend mails the current document (the one being processed when the @function is evaluated) to the recipient designated in the document's SendTo field. The document must have a SendTo field.
  • When used with one or more parameters, @MailSend composes a new mail memo based on the information you supply in the arguments list, and sends it to the recipients listed in the sendTo, copyTo, and blindcopyTo arguments.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~passwordQuality
list.description: Evaluates the return value of a Password data type field with a number.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~pasteBitmapAsBackground
list.description: Pastes a bitmap into the background of a navigator. All other objects in the navigator overlay the background bitmap.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~pasteBitmapAsObject
list.description: Pastes a bitmap into a navigator. The bitmap becomes a hotspot which can be edited like any other hotspot.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~pictureProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for a bitmap in a rich text field.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~postedCommand
list.description: Indicates whether a field is locked by an administration policy and cannot be modified.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~remoteDebugLotusScript

list.title: module:miscellaneous~sendInstantMessage
list.description: Starts a chat with one or more users.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~setCurrentLocation
list.description: Displays the Choose Location dialog box, where you can choose your current workstation location, such as Office, Island, or Travel.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~setEnvironment
list.description: Sets an environment variable stored in the user's notes.ini file (Windows™, OS/2, and UNIX™) or Notes® Preferences file (Macintosh).

list.title: module:miscellaneous~setHTTPHeader
list.description: In a Web application, sets the value of HTTP headers in the response being generated by the server for the browser client.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~setViewInfo
list.description: In Standard Outline views, filters a view to display only documents from a specified category. In Calendar views, filters a view to display only documents that contain a specified string in a specified column.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~smartIconsFloating
list.description: Makes the SmartIcons palette "float" so that users can move it around on the screen.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~smartIconsNextSet
list.description: Switches to display the next set of SmartIcons in the Icon bar.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~styleCycleKey
list.description: Cycles through the list of styles that have been defined for the current document, form, or page. This is the same as pressing F11. Each time you invoke StyleCycleKey, a different style goes into effect.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~validateInternetAddress
list.description: Validates an Internet address based on the RFC 822 or RFC 821 Address Format Syntax.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~verifyPassword
list.description: Compares two passwords.

list.title: module:miscellaneous~viewShowThisUnread
list.description: Changes a view to show only unread documents, or to show read and unread documents.

list.title: module:open~openFrameset
list.description: Opens a frameset defined for the current database. Framesets provide a way for designers to display several pages at the same time. A frame is actually one page; a frameset is a collection of pages. Page designers can create links between frames. A major advantage of framesets is the ability to leave one page constant as users scroll or link to other pages.

list.title: module:open~openHelpDocument
list.description: Allows you to create your own context-sensitive help documents. To use this command, you must first create a view that has a sorted first column containing key values that uniquely identify each help document. @Command([OpenHelpDocument]) searches this sorted view for the specified key value and, if found, displays the associated help document in a separate Help window.

list.title: module:open~openPage

list.title: module:open~openView

list.title: module:text
list.description: Text & Strings

list.title: module:text~abstract
list.description:
Abbreviates the contents of one or more fields by:

  • Selecting the most significant words in a body of text
  • Abbreviating common words
  • Dropping vowels from words
  • Removing unnecessary text or characters, such as mail headers or white space

list.title: module:text~abstractSimple
list.description: Creates a short abstract of a text or rich text field. Simpler and more efficient than using @Abstract.

list.title: module:text~ascii
list.description: Converts an LMBCS (Lotus® Multi-Byte Character Set) string to an ASCII string.

list.title: module:text~begins
list.description: Determines whether a particular substring is stored at the beginning of another string.

list.title: module:text~char
list.description: Converts IBM Code Page 850 code number into the corresponding single character string.

list.title: module:text~compare
list.description: Compares the alphabetic order of the elements in two lists pair-wise.

list.title: module:text~contains
list.description: Determines whether a substring is stored within a string.

list.title: module:text~ends
list.description: Determines if a substring is at the end of a string.

list.title: module:text~fileDir
list.description: Returns the directory portion of a path name, that is, the path name minus the file name.

list.title: module:text~fixed
list.description:
Formats a number as text with a fixed number of decimals.

Category: Text

list.title: module:text~isNumber
list.description: Indicates if a given value is a number (or a number list).

list.title: module:text~isText
list.description: Indicates whether a value is text (or a text list).

list.title: module:text~isTime
list.description: Indicates whether a value is a time-date (or a time-date list).

list.title: module:text~left
list.description: Searches a string from left to right and returns the leftmost characters of the string.

list.title: module:text~leftBack
list.description: Searches a string from right to left and returns a substring.

list.title: module:text~length
list.description: Returns the number of characters in a text string.

list.title: module:text~like
list.description: Matches a string with a pattern. It is case-sensitive and supports the NotesSQL ODBC driver.

list.title: module:text~lowerCase
list.description: Converts the uppercase letters in the specified string to lowercase.

list.title: module:text~matches
list.description: Tests a string for a pattern string. Because the pattern string can contain a number of "wildcard" characters and logical symbols, you can test for complex character patterns.

list.title: module:text~middle
list.description: Returns any substring from the middle of a string. The middle is found by scanning the string from left to right, and parameters determine where the middle begins and ends.

list.title: module:text~middleBack
list.description: Returns any substring from the middle of a string. The middle is found by scanning the string from right to left, and parameters determine where the middle begins and ends.

list.title: module:text~narrow
list.description: Converts full-pitch alphanumeric characters (double byte characters -- DBCS) in the specified string to half-pitch alphanumeric characters (single byte characters -- SBCS). This function works in Japanese, Korean, Simplified Chinese, and traditional Chinese environments. In the Japanese environment, this function can convert full-pitch Katakana as well.

list.title: module:text~newLine
list.description: returns a new line (carriage return) into a text string.

list.title: module:text~properCase
list.description: Converts the words in a string to proper-name capitalization: the first letter of each word becomes uppercase, all others become lowercase.

list.title: module:text~repeat
list.description: Repeats a string a specified number of times.

list.title: module:text~replaceSubstring
list.description: Replaces specific words or phrases in a string with new words or phrases that you specify. Case sensitive.

list.title: module:text~right
list.description: Returns the rightmost characters in the string. You can specify the number of rightmost characters you want returned, or you can indicate that you want all the characters following a specific substring.

list.title: module:text~rightBack
list.description: Returns the rightmost characters in a string.

list.title: module:text~text
list.description: Converts any value to a text string.

list.title: module:text~textAlignCenter
list.description: Centers the current text.

list.title: module:text~textAlignFull
list.description: Aligns text along the left margin.

list.title: module:text~textAlignLeft
list.description: Aligns text along the left margin.

list.title: module:text~textAlignNone
list.description: Reverses the previously specified alignment settings.

list.title: module:text~textAlignRight
list.description: Aligns text along the right margin.

list.title: module:text~textBold
list.description: Makes the selected and subsequently entered text bold. This command is a toggle; selecting it again removes the bold.

list.title: module:text~textBullet
list.description: Applies the bullet attribute to selected and subsequently entered text.

list.title: module:text~textCycleSpacing
list.description: Resets the interline spacing below the selected text to single, one and a half, or double.

list.title: module:text~textEnlargeFont
list.description: Increases selected and subsequently entered text to the next larger point size.

list.title: module:text~textFont
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the current text, where the user can select the typeface, size, color, and style attributes.

list.title: module:text~textItalic
list.description: Italicizes the selected and subsequently entered text. This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time removes the italics.

list.title: module:text~textNormal
list.description: Removes all style attributes from selected and subsequently entered text.

list.title: module:text~textNumbers
list.description: Applies the numbers attribute to selected and subsequently entered text.

list.title: module:text~textOutdent
list.description: Outdents selected and subsequently entered text by narrowing its left margin.

list.title: module:text~textParagraph
list.description: Displays the Paragraph Alignment panel of the Text Properties box.

list.title: module:text~textParagraphStyles
list.description: Displays the Paragraph Styles panel of the Text Properties box.

list.title: module:text~textPermanentPen
list.description: Toggles the permanent pen.

list.title: module:text~textReduceFont
list.description: Decreases the selected text to the next smaller point size.

list.title: module:text~textSetFontColor
list.description: Displays selected or subsequently entered text using the specified color.

list.title: module:text~textSetFontFace
list.description: Displays selected or subsequently entered text using the specified typeface.

list.title: module:text~textSetFontSize
list.description: Displays text using the specified point size.

list.title: module:text~textSpacingDouble
list.description: Sets Interline spacing below the selected text to double.

list.title: module:text~textSpacingOneAndAHalf
list.description: Sets interline spacing below the selected text to one and a half.

list.title: module:text~textSpacingSingle
list.description: Sets interline spacing below the selected text to single.

list.title: module:text~textToNumber
list.description: Converts a text string to a number, where possible.

list.title: module:text~textToTime
list.description: Converts a text string to a time-date value, where possible.

list.title: module:text~textUnderline
list.description: Underlines selected and subsequently entered text. This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time removes the underlining.

list.title: module:text~timeToTextInZone
list.description: Converts a time-date value to a text string, incorporating time zone information.

list.title: module:text~timeZoneToText
list.description: Converts a canonical time zone value to a human-readable text string.

list.title: module:text~toNumber
list.description: Converts a value to a number.

list.title: module:text~toTime
list.description: Converts a value with a data type of text or time to a date-time value.

list.title: module:text~trim
list.description: Removes leading, trailing, and redundant spaces from a text string, or from each element of a text list.

list.title: module:text~upperCase
list.description: Converts the lowercase letters in the specified string to uppercase.

list.title: module:text~wide
list.description: Converts half-pitch alphanumeric characters (single-byte characters -- SBCS) in the specified string to full-pitch alphanumeric characters (double-byte characters -- DBCS). This function works in Japanese, Korean, Simplified Chinese, and traditional Chinese environments. In the Japanese environment, this function can convert half-pitch Katakana as well.

list.title: module:text~word
list.description: Returns the specified word from a text string. A "word" is defined as the part of a string that is delimited by the defined separator character. For example, if you specify a space (" ") as the separator, then a word is any series of characters preceded by and followed by a space (or the beginning or end of the string).

list.title: module:tools
list.description: Tools

list.title: module:tools~toolsCall
list.description: Displays the Call Server dialog box, where the user can select a server to dial in to.

list.title: module:tools~toolsCategorize
list.description: Categorizes the current document.

list.title: module:tools~toolsHangUp
list.description: Displays the Hang Up dialog box.

list.title: module:tools~toolsMarkAllRead
list.description: Marks all of the documents in a database as read.

list.title: module:tools~toolsMarkAllUnread
list.description: Marks all of the documents in a database as unread.

list.title: module:tools~toolsMarkSelectedRead
list.description: In a view or folder, marks all of the selected documents as read.

list.title: module:tools~toolsMarkSelectedUnread
list.description: In a view or folder, marks all of the selected documents as unread.

list.title: module:tools~toolsRefreshAllDocs
list.description: Refreshes the fields of all the documents in a view or folder.

list.title: module:tools~toolsRefreshSelectedDocs
list.description: Refreshes the fields of all the selected documents in a view or folder.

list.title: module:tools~toolsReplicate
list.description: Displays the Replicate dialog box, where the user can choose to replicate the current database using the options defined in Replicator or using special one-time options.

list.title: module:tools~toolsRunBackgroundMacros
list.description: Runs all of the database's scheduled agents, regardless of when they are scheduled to run. The agents will then run as usual at their regularly scheduled times.

list.title: module:tools~toolsRunMacro
list.description: Executes a specified agent.

list.title: module:tools~toolsScanUnreadChoose
list.description: Displays the Scan Unread Preferred Setup dialog box, where the user can select the preferred databases to be scanned for unread documents.

list.title: module:tools~toolsScanUnreadPreferred
list.description: Displays the Scan Unread dialog box, where the user can see unread counts for each of the user preferred databases.

list.title: module:tools~toolsScanUnreadSelected
list.description: Opens the selected database to the first unread document. The user can then navigate to subsequent unread documents.

list.title: module:tools~toolsSetupLocation
list.description: Opens the current location document in your Personal Address Book in Edit mode, allowing you to change your home server, mail database location, and time zone.

list.title: module:tools~toolsSetupMail
list.description: Displays the Mail section of the User Preferences dialog box, where the user can indicate how often Notes® should check for new mail, whether to sign and encrypt outgoing mail, and so on.

list.title: module:tools~toolsSetupPorts
list.description: Displays the Ports section of the User Preferences dialog box, where the user can enable and disable network ports.

list.title: module:tools~toolsSetupUserSetup
list.description: Displays the Basics section of the User Preferences dialog box, where the user defines Notes® startup options.

list.title: module:tools~toolsSmartIcons
list.description: Displays the Toolbar Preferences dialog box where you can create new toolbars and customize the content and display of existing toolbars.

list.title: module:tools~toolsSpellCheck
list.description: Starts the Notes® spell checker.

list.title: module:tools~toolsUserLogoff
list.description: Logs the user off of all Domino® servers. Reconnecting to a Domino® server requires the user Notes® ID and, if one is set, password.

list.title: module:URL
list.description: url

list.title: module:URL~urlDecode
list.description: Decodes a URL string into regular text.

list.title: module:URL~urlEncode
list.description: Encodes a string into a URL-safe format.

list.title: module:URL~urlGetHeader
list.description: Returns specific Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) header information from the Uniform Resource Locator (URL). A URL is a text string used for identifying and addressing a Web page.

list.title: module:URL~urlHistory
list.description: Used for navigating, saving, and reloading a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) history list. The URL history list keeps track of all the Web pages you have visited. The history list is used for the Next and Previous buttons and for the Web Tours.

list.title: module:URL~urlOpen
list.description: Retrieves a World Wide Web page specified by its URL.

list.title: module:URL~urlQueryString
list.description: In a Web application, returns the current URL command and parameters, or the value of one of the parameters.

list.title: module:user-environment
list.description: User Environment

list.title: module:user-environment~domain
list.description: Returns the name of the current user's Domino® mail domain listed in the current location document of the Personal Address Book.

list.title: module:user-environment~mailDbName
list.description: Returns the name of the Domino® server and the name of the current user's mail database.

list.title: module:user-environment~name
list.description:
Allows you to manipulate hierarchical names. You can abbreviate the canonical format of a name, expand an abbreviated name to its canonical format, identify particular components within the name, and reverse the order of the components so that you can categorize a view by hierarchical names.

Enables you to convert a name between the Domino® and LDAP formats.

list.title: module:user-environment~optimizeMailAddress
list.description: Returns a mail address with all unnecessary domains removed.

list.title: module:user-environment~password
list.description: Encodes a string.

list.title: module:user-environment~platform
list.description: Returns the name of the currently running platform version of Notes, Domino, or Nomad.

list.title: module:user-environment~statusBar
list.description: Writes a message or messages to the status bar.

list.title: module:user-environment~userAccess
list.description: Given a server and file name, indicates the current user's level of access to the database.

list.title: module:user-environment~userName
list.description:
Returns the current user name.

If the user name is hierarchical, @UserName returns it in canonical format (including the CN, OU, O, and C identifiers). To return the name in abbreviated format (omitting those identifiers), use @V3UserName.

list.title: module:user-environment~userNameLanguage
list.description: Returns language tags associated with the user ID.

list.title: module:user-environment~userNamesList
list.description:
For a database on a server or a local database with "Enforce a consistent Access Control List across all replicas" in effect, @UserNamesList returns a text list containing the following information for the current user:

  • Common name
  • All hierarchical names (fully distinguished) that include the user name; for example, CN=My Name/OU=My Org Unit/O=My Org, plus */OU=My Org Unit/O=My Org, */O=My Org, and *
  • Any roles associated with the user in the ACL
  • All groups to which the user belongs (only if the database is on a server)

list.title: module:user-environment~userPrivileges
list.description: Returns a text list of the current user's privileges. This function returns only the position of the privilege in the privilege list, not the name of the privilege.

list.title: module:user-environment~userRoles
list.description: For a database on a server or a local replicated database, returns a list of roles that the current user has. Roles are defined in a database's access control list.

list.title: module:user-environment~v3UserName
list.description:
Returns the current user name or server name. Using @V3UserName on a local database or in a private view in a server-based database returns the user's name.

If the user name is hierarchical, @V3UserName returns the name in abbreviated format (omitting the CN, OU, O, and C identifiers). To return the name in canonical format, use @UserName.

list.title: module:user-environment~v4UserAccess
list.description: Given a server and file name, indicates the current user's level of access to the database.

list.title: module:user-environment~version
list.description: Returns the release number of the Notes/Domino software you're running.

list.title: module:userid
list.description: User Id

list.title: module:userid~userIDCertificates
list.description: Displays the Certificates section of the User ID dialog box. If the user ID is password-protected, the user must enter the password before displaying the dialog box.

list.title: module:userid~userIDClearPassword
list.description: Displays the Enter Password dialog box where the password associated with the user ID can be removed.

list.title: module:userid~userIDCreateSafeCopy
list.description: Displays the Enter Safe Copy ID File Name dialog box, where the user defines a file name for storing a safe copy of the Notes/Domino user ID. The safe copy contains only the user name and public key. The private key and all certificates are omitted from the safe copy.

list.title: module:userid~userIDEncryptionKeys
list.description: Displays the Encryption section of the User ID dialog box. If the user ID is password-protected, the user must enter the password before displaying the dialog box.

list.title: module:userid~userIDInfo
list.description: Displays the Basics section of the User ID Information dialog box.

list.title: module:userid~userIDMergeCopy
list.description: Displays the Choose User ID to Merge into Current® ID dialog box. This lets the user select an updated user ID (for example, one that has been certified by an administrator) and merge it into the existing user ID (thus retaining the information already stored in the existing ID). If the user ID is password-protected, Notes/Domino requires the user to enter the password before displaying the dialog box.

list.title: module:userid~userIDSetPassword
list.description: Displays the Set Password dialog box where the user can enter a new password for the Notes/Domino ID. If a password already exists, the user must enter the existing password before specifying a new one.

list.title: module:userid~userIDSwitch
list.description: Displays the Choose User ID to Switch To dialog box. If the selected ID is password-protected, Notes/Domino next displays the Enter Password dialog box, where the user must enter the correct password.

list.title: module:view
list.description: View

list.title: module:view~getViewInfo
list.description: Returns a view attribute.

list.title: module:view~viewArrangeIcons
list.description: Aligns database icons on the current workspace page from left to right and beginning to end.

list.title: module:view~viewBelowFolders
list.description: Places the view pane at the end of the screen and the folder pane at the beginning.

list.title: module:view~viewBesideFolders
list.description: Places the view pane at the right of the screen and the folder pane at the left.

list.title: module:view~viewCertify
list.description: Displays the Choose Certifier ID dialog box, in which you specify the certification to be renewed for the selected user or users.

list.title: module:view~viewChange
list.description: Switches to the specified view or folder within the current database or, if a view or folder is not specified, displays the View menu so the user can select a view.

list.title: module:view~viewCollapse
list.description: Collapses all levels of subcategories, documents, and responses within the current category, so only the first category name shows. If the view or folder has a response hierarchy but is not categorized, ViewCollapse collapses all levels of response documents under the current main document.

list.title: module:view~viewCollapseAll
list.description: Collapses all levels of categories, subcategories, documents, and responses within a view or folder so that only the first level of category names appears. If the view or folder has a response hierarchy but is not categorized, ViewCollapseAll collapses all levels of response documents under the main documents.

list.title: module:view~viewExpand
list.description: Expands one level of subcategories, documents, and responses within the current category. If the view or folder has a response hierarchy but is not categorized, ViewExpand expands all levels of response documents under the current main document.

list.title: module:view~viewExpandAll
list.description: Expands all levels of categories, subcategories, documents, and responses within the view or folder.

list.title: module:view~viewExpandWithChildren
list.description: Expands all levels of subcategories, documents, and responses within the selected category.

list.title: module:view~viewHorizScrollBar
list.description: Toggles display of the horizontal scroll bar in a view or folder.

list.title: module:view~viewMoveName
list.description: Displays the Choose Certifier ID dialog box, which allows you to specify the organizational unit for which you want to certify the selected user.

list.title: module:view~viewNavigatorsFolders
list.description: Displays the Folders and Views navigators in the navigator pane and the view or folder that the user most recently selected.

list.title: module:view~viewNavigatorsNone
list.description: Hides the navigator pane.

list.title: module:view~viewRefreshFields
list.description: Recalculates the fields in the current document or updates the current view or folder.

list.title: module:view~viewRefreshUnread
list.description: Updates the unread counts on all database icons displayed on the current workspace page.

list.title: module:view~viewRenamePerson
list.description: Displays the Certify Selected Entries dialog box, which enables you to upgrade the selected user name to a hierarchical name, change the user's common name, or change the user's hierarchical name.

list.title: module:view~viewShowFieldHelp
list.description: Shows field Help, so that the Help description for the current field (if available) appears on the status bar while the user composes or edits a document. (Field Help is a design option specified in the Field Properties box.) This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time hides the field Help.

list.title: module:view~viewShowObject
list.description: Displays the "object delimiter" -- a dotted frame surrounding an OLE/LEL object within a field. This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time hides the object delimiter so the OLE/LEL object looks like regular, editable data.

list.title: module:view~viewShowOnlyCategories
list.description: Collapses the view or folder so that only category and subcategory names show up. This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time expands all category levels.

list.title: module:view~viewShowOnlySearchResults
list.description: Shows the results of a full-text search as selected documents in a view or folder. This command is a toggle. Instead of listing only the documents that satisfy the search query (the default for a full-text search), the view or folder lists all the documents it normally lists, with a check mark in front of those documents that satisfy the search query.

list.title: module:view~viewShowOnlySelected
list.description: Displays only the selected documents or categories in the view or folder (those documents with a check mark). This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time displays all documents or categories.

list.title: module:view~viewShowOnlyUnread
list.description: Displays only the unread documents in the view or folder. This command is a toggle; selecting it again displays all documents in the view or folder.

list.title: module:view~viewShowPageBreaks
list.description: Displays a line representing each page break in the document. The page breaks indicate where Notes® will end each page when the document is printed on the currently selected printer. This command is a toggle; selecting it a second time suppresses the display of automatic page breaks (manual page breaks will still be displayed).

list.title: module:view~viewShowRuler
list.description: Toggles the display of the ruler while a document is open in Edit mode.

list.title: module:view~viewShowSearchBar
list.description: Toggles the display of the full-text search bar at the beginning of the view. If the database does not have a full-text index, the search bar displays but is not usable.

list.title: module:view~viewShowServerNames
list.description: Toggles the display of server names on the database icons in the user's workspace.

list.title: module:view~viewShowUnread
list.description: Toggles the display of the unread document count on each database icon on the user's workspace.

list.title: module:view~viewSwitchForm
list.description: Changes the form used to display the current document.

list.title: module:volt-formula
list.description: Volt Formula

list.title: module:volt-formula~context
list.description: Gets the current API context (if ctx param is null or not supplied) or Sets the API context to either database for local DOM, for those APIs that require working with differents contexts such as GetField/SetField

list.title: module:volt-formula~debug
list.description: Uses the console object's methods to display Debug messages, prepending them with a timestamp. Defaults to console.log() if no type of logger is supplied

list.title: module:window
list.description: Window

list.title: module:window~closeWindow
list.description: Same as the File - Close command menu. Closes the current Notes® tab, or the window if this was the last tab in the window. If the document or design element in that window has not been saved, Notes® prompts the user to save it before closing.

list.title: module:window~refreshWindow
list.description: Reloads or refreshes the contents of the current window.

list.title: module:window~reloadWindow
list.description: Reloads or refreshes the contents of the current window.

list.title: module:window~windowCascade
list.description: Resizes all open Notes/Domino windows to less than 50% of their maximum window size and layers them in a cascading stack. Because the layered stack is cascaded, the title bar of each window is visible behind the stack's first window. To display a window that is lower in the stack, you can make it first by clicking its title bar.

list.title: module:window~windowMaximize
list.description: Maximizes the active Notes/Domino window (the window whose title bar is highlighted).

list.title: module:window~windowMaximizeAll
list.description: Maximizes all open Notes/Domino windows. Notes/Domino windows include the Designer and Administration client windows as well as any of the Notes® Help windows.

list.title: module:window~windowMinimize
list.description: Minimizes the active Notes/Domino window (the window whose title bar is highlighted).

list.title: module:window~windowMinimizeAll
list.description: Minimizes all open Notes/Domino windows. Notes/Domino windows include the Designer and Administration client windows as well as any of the Notes® Help windows.

list.title: module:window~windowNext
list.description: Maximizes the Notes® window whose taskbar button follows the current window's taskbar button or, if the windows are cascaded, moves the next window in the stack to the beginning of the stack.

list.title: module:window~windowRestore
list.description: Restores the active window to its former size (before it was maximized or minimized).

list.title: module:window~windowTile
list.description: Resizes all open Notes/Domino windows to display them all at once. The open windows are tiled across the screen until they fill the background. If two windows are currently open, Notes® displays them side-by-side. If four windows are open, Notes® displays one in each of the four quadrants of the window.

list.title: module:window~windowWorkspace
list.description: Displays the Notes/Domino workspace as the active window.

list.title: module:workspace
list.description: workspace

list.title: module:workspace~workspaceProperties
list.description: Displays the Properties box for the Notes/Domino workspace.

list.title: module:workspace~workspaceStackReplicaIcons
list.description: For databases on the workspace that are replicas of one another, stacks them into a single icon. The command is a toggle; selecting it a second time unstacks the replica icons and displays each icon individually.
